workflow.name: Optimize technical manuals for RAG & agents with Blockify IdeaBlocks
workflow.description:
# Blockify¬Æ Technical Manual Data Optimization Workflow

## Blockify Optimizes Data for Technical Manual RAG and Agents - Giving Structure to Unstructured Data for ~78X Accuracy, when pairing Blockify Ingest and Blockify Distill

## Learn more at [https://iternal.ai/blockify](https://iternal.ai/blockify)

### Get Free Demo API Access here: [https://console.blockify.ai/signup](https://console.blockify.ai/signup)

### Read the Technical Whitepaper here: [https://iternal.ai/blockify-results](https://iternal.ai/blockify-results)

### See example Accuracy Comparison here: [https://iternal.ai/case-studies/medical-accuracy/](https://iternal.ai/case-studies/medical-accuracy/)

Blockify is a data optimization tool that takes messy, unstructured text, like hundreds of sales‚Äëmeeting transcripts or long proposals, and intelligently optimizes the data into small, easy‚Äëto‚Äëunderstand "IdeaBlocks." Each IdeaBlock is just a couple of sentences in length that capture one clear idea, plus a built‚Äëin contextualized question and answer.

With this approach, Blockify improves accuracy of LLMs (Large Language Models) by an average aggregate 78X, while shrinking the original mountain of text to about 2.5% of its size while keeping (and even improving) the important information.

When Blockify's IdeaBlocks are compared with the usual method of breaking text into equal‚Äësized chunks, the results are dramatic. Answers pulled from the distilled IdeaBlocks are roughly 40X more accurate, and user searches return the right information about 52% more accurate. In short, Blockify lets you store less data, spend less on computing, and still get better answers- turning huge documents into a concise, high‚Äëquality knowledge base that anyone can search quickly.

Blockify works by processing chunks of text to create structured data from an unstructured data source.

Blockify¬Æ replaces the traditional "dump‚Äëand‚Äëchunk" approach with an end‚Äëto‚Äëend pipeline that cleans and organizes content before it ever hits a vector store.

Admins first define who should see what, then the system ingests any file type‚ÄîWord, PDF, slides, images‚Äîinside public cloud, private cloud, or on‚Äëprem. A ‚Äãcontext‚Äëaware splitter finds natural breaks, and a series of specially developed Blockify LLM model turns each segment into a draft IdeaBlock.

GenAI systems fed with this curated data return sharper answers, hallucinate far less, and comply with security policies out of the box.

The result: higher trust, lower operating cost, and a clear path to enterprise‚Äëscale RAG without the cleanup headaches that stall most AI rollouts.

nodes.name: Strip and Clean to Aggregate XML

assignments.name: output
assignments.value:
={{ String($items()
  .flatMap(i => i.json['manual-sections'] || [])
  .flatMap(sec => [].concat(sec?.['manual-section'] || []))
  .map(c => c?.choices?.[0]?.message?.content
        ?? c?.choices?.[0]?.delta?.content
        ?? (typeof c === 'string' ? c : c?.content ?? ''))
  .join(''))
  .replace(/```[\w#+.-]*\s*\r?\n?|```/g, '') }}

parameters.content:
## Extract Data from PDF Into Markdown

Through a user selected method you can extract data from the file and convert that text into a markdown output which uses ```#``` and ```##``` and ```###``` etc for headers.

We have a proprietary PDF extraction process and workflow that we've developed, however you can use whatever you like, as long as the text is output as proper markdown with headers.

## Collect Source Documents and Upload to S3 and Get Signed URL for Processing

Extract data and prepare to convert into markdown through any traditional methods so the information can be passed into the Blockify text based API.

This sample uses a simple .PDF file uploaded to Google Drive, but the content could be anything.

## Parse Markdown and Split into Specific Chunks at Header Breaks

Chunk using a special chunking method. See Documentation provided as a note within this workflow for details in: "Markdown Document Chunking Guidelines" in the documentation: https://docs.google.com/document/d/14goJMiMm1gU4XWe4mWWQN5ao8dKi5bwg5zrNEZR18oc/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.82v51btyigaq

## Assemble Payload for Blockify API following Specific Documentation Guidelines

Assemble the chunks into a very specific payload structure which the LLM has been tuned on.

```### Primary ### --- [The main content that you want to Blockify from your technical manual goes here.] --- ### Proceeding ### --- [The section that comes before the Primary Section goes here.] --- ### Following ### --- [The section that comes after the Primary Section goes here.]```

## Run API for All Chunks and Extract the XML Blockified Result

### Get your free trial API key here: https://console.blockify.ai/signup

Blockify Ingest is designed to receive input raw source (parsed / chunked) text via LLM API request and output structured optimized XML ‚ÄúIdeaBlocks,‚Äù repackaging the source data into a cleaned format. 

The process is ‚âà99% lossless for numerical data, facts, and key information. We always encourage a human to be in the loop to review the outputs of IdeaBlock content.

For technical manuals use the model ```technical-ingest```

## Sample of Output Collection Method.

Formal approach would likely leverage a database of some kind where the user parses the XML into a database row with different columns to filter the relevant information for effective RAG and Agentic processing.

### NOTE YOU MAY CHOOSE A DIFFERENT OUTPUT METHOD - I.E. A DATABASE

# Step 1: Blockify Technical Manual Ingest
## Workflow for the Blockify Ingest Component. Does not include the Blockify Distill Component which is independent of the Ingest stage.

# Blockify¬Æ Data Optimization Workflow

## Blockify Optimizes Data for RAG - Giving Structure to Unstructured Data for ~78X Accuracy, when pairing Blockify Ingest and Blockify Distill

## Learn more at [https://iternal.ai/blockify](https://iternal.ai/blockify)

### Get Free Demo API Access here: [https://console.blockify.ai/signup](https://console.blockify.ai/signup)

### Read the Technical Whitepaper here: [https://iternal.ai/blockify-results](https://iternal.ai/blockify-results)

### See example Accuracy Comparison here: [https://iternal.ai/case-studies/medical-accuracy/](https://iternal.ai/case-studies/medical-accuracy/)

Blockify is a data optimization tool that takes messy, unstructured text, like hundreds of sales‚Äëmeeting transcripts or long proposals, and intelligently optimizes the data into small, easy‚Äëto‚Äëunderstand "IdeaBlocks." Each IdeaBlock is just a couple of sentences in length that capture one clear idea, plus a built‚Äëin contextualized question and answer.

With this approach, Blockify improves accuracy of LLMs (Large Language Models) by an average aggregate 78X, while shrinking the original mountain of text to about 2.5% of its size while keeping (and even improving) the important information.

This version of Blockify is designed specifically for Technical Manuals and data where order and sequence matters. This process of ingestion is different from the unordered ingest process also available as part of Blockify.

Blockify works by processing chunks of text to create structured data from an unstructured data source.

Blockify¬Æ replaces the traditional "dump‚Äëand‚Äëchunk" approach with an end‚Äëto‚Äëend pipeline that cleans and organizes content before it ever hits a vector store.

Admins first define who should see what, then the system ingests any file type‚ÄîWord, PDF, slides, images‚Äîinside public cloud, private cloud, or on‚Äëprem. A ‚Äãcontext‚Äëaware splitter finds natural breaks, and a series of specially developed Blockify LLM model turns each segment into a draft IdeaBlock.

GenAI systems fed with this curated data return sharper answers, hallucinate far less, and comply with security policies out of the box.

The result: higher trust, lower operating cost, and a clear path to enterprise‚Äëscale RAG without the cleanup headaches that stall most AI rollouts.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
